mSbnNp79.title: A wireless multipoint temperature measurement system based on DS18B20
mSbnNp79.abstract: The paper make use of AT89C2051 MCU as the core,DS18B20 as the temperature sensor,prt2030 as the wireless transceiver modul of the system.It can realize multipoint temperature measurement in the storage,water tank and greenhouse.The system has low signal disturbance,it will have some application value.

axnhcQkA.title: The Research of OVSF Code Allocation Scheme in HSDPA Systems
axnhcQkA.abstract: Wireless resource allocation scheme has an important effect on the performance of wireless networks.This paper analyzed the advantage and disadvantage of static and dynamic code allocation scheme in HSDPA systems,and proposed the efficient code allocation scheme for multiuser environment in HSDPA systems.

49zgTnbI.abstract: The paper make use of LN-206P IR temperature sensor to design non-contact thermometer. It has some virtue of temperature measures with non-contact mode and speediness,which make the application of IR thermometer more and more extensive in the hospital and home.It will have the good market application prospect.

grTgRvZA.title: An application of Double DC-DC convertor in the Explosion-flashing alarm lamp
grTgRvZA.abstract: The paper make use of Double DC-DC convertor to resolve some problems of current DC-DC convertor that work in the breadth voltage.these problems include lowering efficiency of switch,switching device working inordinately so much as damage.On the base of current signal lamp,it designs a explosion-flashing alarm lamp with a long life,breadth working voltage,fully functions and convenient in production,management,use and repair.

dXez9Uz0.title: THE APPLICATION OF SEISMIC RESERVIOR PREDICTION TECHNOLOGY IN THE ROLLING EXPLORATION AND DEVELOPMENT IN OLD DISTRICT——TAKING KE XIA FORMATION OF WELL.530 IN DARAMAY OILFIELD AS AN EXAMPLE
dXez9Uz0.abstract: Seismic attributes,not only widely have been used in the hydrocarbon detection and in the prediction of reservoir parameters,but also have been applied in interpretation of the depositional environment.Extracted various attributes from seismic data ke xia Formation Oil reservoir of Well.530.Selected the most sensitive attribute forecasts in sand sedimentary and reservoir characteristics.Combined with rich wear layer well data from ke xia Formation of Well.530,Prediction of expanding border favorable facies distribution and sand distribution law.Using seismic prediction and the well data to verify each other provides favorable protection for the old rolling exploration and development.

FwfyWYbg.title: RESEARCH ON THE REMAINING OIL DISTRIBUTION IN KESHANGZU RESERVIOR IN DISTRICT EIGHT
FwfyWYbg.abstract: According to the situation that the eight grams of the reservoir in Area S4+5 layer does not meet the long-term injection and reservoir pressure keeps declining,combined with the deterioration of the oil wells condition,the imperfect patterns and the region declining production,the reservoir needs to be adjusted.With detailed reservoir characterization for 2008 and a variety of technical methods,the distribution of the remaining oil is described quantificationally and distribution rules of remaining oil is researched.On plane,the remaining oil concentrated near the fault in Ciu,and where patterns are imperfect with a large part of effective thickness;Vertically,the remaining recoverable reserves mainly concentrated in the S51,S52-2,S41-1,S42-2 layer.According to the research of residual oil,deployment control group wells and test wells are highly consistenty with each other,which provides the basis for the secondary development of the whole reservoir and higher oil recovery rate.

VzumBdHr.title: RESERVOIR SIMULATION AND RESIDENT OIL OF CONGLOMERATE OIL RESERVOIR IN WEST-NORTH MARGIN OF JUNGGAR BASIN-OIL RESERVOIR OF T2K2 FORMATION OF YLDONG WELLBOLCK AS AN EXAMPLE
VzumBdHr.abstract: In the Conglomerate oil reservoir of T2k2 formation of YIdong wellblock of Kelamayi oil field,many problems existed in the moderate or high water-bearing period,so reservoir simulation technology is used to solve them.simulation of oil and water movement of the development in the process of affusion is done,and the distribution of remaining oil is analayzed,which can be the guidance for the next step of reservoir exploitation and development plan.It provides important geological foundation for affusion exploitation and enhanced recovery ratio and efficient development of conglomerate oil reservoir in west-north margin of Junggar Basin.

I0kqSPUW.title: Evaluation of Reservoir Quality of Lower Karamay Formation in West District No.1 with Type Logs
I0kqSPUW.abstract: The type logs from west District No.1 in Karamay oilfield are classified as the normal logs and composite logs.The normal logs from most wells are poor in quality,so the porosity and permeability models developed by them are lower in interpretation accuracy.For this reason,this paper proposes that for wells without the composite logs,the normal logs can be inverted to composite logs by means of neural network method,by which the porosity and permeability models are developed on litholgy,thus satisfying the requirement of logging interpretation.On the basis of these,the reservoir quality evaluation the Lower Karamay formation in west District No.1 in Karamay oilfield is conducted.

1722JYyH.title: Fracture Identification Method for Lower Wuerhe Reservoir of District No.8 in Karamay Oil Field
1722JYyH.abstract: Fracture identification and evaluation are difficult to run in the research of reservoir quality in oilfield development.Based on the core data and EMI fracture analysis of Lower Wuerhe reservoir in District No.8 in Karamay oil field,the basic characteristics of various fractures in this area are described,numerous conventional well log data are analyzed and calibrated in terms of natural fractures,thus developing model for identification of the fractures by means of conventional well log data.By processing and interpretation of wells in this area,the types and developed extent of the fractures in single well are confirmed,the space distribution of the fractures in Lower Wuerhe reservoir is revealed.

i5ktKRNb.title: THE COMBINED TECHNOLOGY RESEARCH OF THE RECOGNITION OF WATER FLOODED LAYER EXTRA-LOW PERMEABLE FRACTURE CONGLOMERATE RESERVOIR——CITE THE P2W1 RESERVOIR OF KARAMAY OIL-FIELD AS AN INSTANCE
i5ktKRNb.abstract: It is critical to identify water flooded layer during the adjustment of reservoir. Here is the research of how to identify water flooded layer of extra-low permeable reservoir through comprehensive well-logging、nuclear magnetic-logging during the adjustment of the P2w1 extra-low permeable reservoir, and develop a way to identify water flooded layer of extra-low permeable reservoir, make the water content of early days’ 20% decrease to 8%, and ensure success of the adjustment of reservoir 629 infill-adjustment wells were drilled totally, the deliverability of early days exceeds design one by 44%, which reaches 156×104t a year.

wbUaIrQk.title: RESERVIOIR SIMULATION TECHNOLOGY IN CONGLOMERATE RESERVOIRS WITH HIGH APPLICATION OF ADJUSTMENT——Taking Higher Karamay reservoir in District 8 as an example
wbUaIrQk.abstract: The conglomerate reservoir with heterogeneity characteristics results in the overall poor development of conglomerate reservoir,Especially the reservoir into the high water perlod is often with a "two-speed" and "two-low" phenomenon: water rises rapidly;production declines rapidly;utilization ratio of water is low;low profile is used.It is uncertaion of the distribution of remaining oil,so remaining reserves are difficult to be activated,and reservoir development is difficult to be adjusted later.Based on conglomerate reservoir characteristics of high water cut,the Higher Karamay reservoir in District 8 is studied with reservoir simulation,and the remaining oil distribution is quantified.The key factors affecting the development were predcted and optimized so as to propose reservoir development methods and reasonable limits of technology Based on the simulation results of tracking the implementation of secondary development of adjustment,the results of initial production capacity of new wells and the remaining oil are 90% match with prediction,which shows its significance in oil development.

mSwGN2oz.title: STUDY ON THE WELLTEST INTERPRETATION MODLE AND REASONABLE PRESSURE BUILDUP TEST PERIOD OF LOW-PENETRABILITY THICK CONGLOMERATE RESERVOIR——CITE THE BAQUWUERHE RESERVOIR OF KARAMAY OIL-FIELD AS AN INSTANCE
mSwGN2oz.abstract: The BaQuXiaWuHe reserivior in Kalamay oil-field belongs to low permeability thick conglomerate reservoir, which has complicated and various welltest interpretation modle.But the single Darcy flow welltest modle couldn't meet the need in welltest data interpretation.This article has founded a new welltest interpretation modle——the non-Darcy flow welltest modle by analyzing and studying the reserivior flow mechanism so as to improve the dependability of outcome in welltest data interpretation and it accords to the reserivior fact better.At the same time,the reasonable pressure buildup test period has been ascertained, in order to provide reference experience for welltesting in the same type reserivior.

a8fq1ux3.title: Distribution of Sand Body of Lower Sub-Formation of Karamay Formation(Kexia Sub-Formation) in West No.1 District in Karamay Oilfield
a8fq1ux3.abstract: The Kexia sub-formation in west No.1 distribution in Karamay oilfield is a well-developed fan delta depositional system whose sand body types consist of braided channels,channel bar,channel margin,interchannel mud,underwater distributary channel,underwater distributary channel margin,underwater distributary interchannel mud,distal bar,pre-fan delta mud.By using cross-hole simulation technique and well logs,four superposition patterns of complex channels are identified: isolate type,butt joint type,cut overlapping type and superimposed type.Meanwhile,according to the cross-hole simulation and the six principles of sand body lateral comparison(height difference,thickness difference,configuration difference,range difference,rhythm difference and quality(productivity) difference),the vertical and horizontal characteristics of the sand body of the Kexia sub-formation are obtained,which can support adjustments for further field development in this area.

O2ChMERY.title: 256 Strike-Slip Fault Zone Characteristic and Its Geological Significance in Northwestern Margin of Junggar Basin
O2ChMERY.abstract: This paper,using 3D seismic information and well log data,combined with regional geological features,presents the distribution characteristic of this fault zone and suggests that such a fault is characterized by strike-slip nature flower structure,riband effect,crushed zone and volcanic rock body leap,etc.It has an important effect on Lower Wuerhe reservoir,and the extension area of this fault zone could be an oil-gas enriched area.

kIHfE9yi.title: Fine research of sedimentary microfacies and single sand-body and conglomerate resevoir in north-west margin of Junggar Basin——taking T_2k_2~4 oil-bearing formation of Kelamayi Oilfield as an example
kIHfE9yi.abstract: According to a large amount of well logging and drilling core information,the fan-delta plain and fan-delta front sub-facies constitute the main depositional systems of T2k24 formation of Kelamayi Oilfield.The fan-delta plain sub-facies can be divided into distributary channel microfacies,flood fan microfacies,and distributary interchannel microfacies.The fan-delta front sub-facies consists of sedimentary microfacies of mouth bar,far san dam,and distributary interchannel.Through dividing and grouping lithofacies,combining with core datum,a logging sedimentary microfacies model is established to determine the distribution feature of sedi-mentary microfacies and to reveal the space distribution law of single sand-body.Thus,it provides important geological foundation for remaining oil forecast and development adjustment of conglomerate reservoirs in west-north margin of Junggar Basin.

pXzpu0ca.title: Study on the Status Quo of the Health Literacy in Chronic Disease Prevention among Urban Residents
pXzpu0ca.abstract: Objective To understand the urban residents’ status quo of the health literacy in chronic disease prevention and explore the influencing factors. Methods A crossed-sectional study was applied. 876 urban residents in 10 communities were selected by the multi-stage random sampling and surveyed with face-to-face interview. Results The rate was 6.6% of chronic disease prevention health literacy in urban residents. Factors as gender, age, education, employment and marriage had no significant effect on the health literacy. Conclusion The health literacy of chronic disease prevention was low among urban residents. We should make intervention to improve health literacy of urban residents.

agge92Fq.title: Investigation on Community Health Counseling Spots in Luwan District,Shanghai City
agge92Fq.abstract: OBJECTIVE To study community health counseling spots' operation,and to provide evidence for construction of community health counseling spots.METHOD By cross-sectional survey in different groups including community health counseling spot workers and community residents,there is collected of hardware and software facilities,operation,quality of service,and so on.RESULT A total of 69 community health counseling spots took part in this survey 34(49.3%)of them were special housing,48(69.6%) have reading frame and 49(71.1%)have free reading for community residents.There are 80 workers in 69 community health counseling spots,and 68.6% of them are medical workers,but 14 community health counseling spots are not medical workers for service.61(88.4%) spots provide services once a week,3(4.3%)spots provide services twice a week,2(2.9%)spots provide services once two week,and once service is less than four hours.67.5% community residents have enjoyed community health counseling spots services,including measuring blood pressure and getting free reading.CONCLUSION Development of community health counseling spots in Luwan District is limited by workplace,funding,workers and inefficient service.So the combination of its development and the function of community health service station well be the trend from now on.

TcgW4V8N.title: Status Quo of Overweight and Obesity and Related Behaviors among 160 Civil Servants
TcgW4V8N.abstract: Objective To understand the civil servants’ status quo of overweight or obesity and their relevant knowledge, attitudes and behaviors. Methods A cross-sectional study was conducted with the convenience-based sampling in 4 communities, and totally 160 civil servants were interviewed. Questionnaires and medical checks were employed. Through medical checks, data were obtained of height and weight for overweight and obesity status. Knowledge, attitudes and behaviors of overweight and obesity were learned by questionnaires. Results The rate of overweight and that of obesity in public employees were 26.3% and 6.9% respectively. Both rates for males were higher than those for females. 85.6% civil servants regarded obesity as disease. And 96.9% of them thought that weight control was needed if one was overweight or obesity. Only 15.1% civil servants took part in physical exercises more than 3 times per week, and 78.8% of them sat in working time more than 6 hours per day. Conclusion There were less physical exercises and more sitting hours for civil servants. The incidence of overweight and obesity in civil servants was higher. Integrated measures must be taken for prevention and control.

MvjeJi0z.title: Investigation and Analysis of Smoking and Smoking-quitting Service among Medical Staff
MvjeJi0z.abstract: Objective To learn medical staff's smoking and their attitudes and behaviors towards smoking control in non-smoking medical institutions.Methods 576 medical staff and workers were investigated by questionnaire in non-smoking medical institutions in Luwan area.Results The overall smoking rate of medical staff is 9.55%.Smoking rate among males is 39.7%.About 95% medical staff hold positive attitude to setting up non-smoking medical institutions and providing smoking quitting service.But in practice only 49.7% medical staff had ever offered smoking quitting service before investigated.Factors influencing medical staff's offering smoking quitting service are the characters of their work, subjective attitudes and wishes as well as receiving the training or not of smoking-quitting methods and skills.Conclusion It is suggested to strengthen the education on medical staff's responsibility for smoking quitting and improve their skills and abilities on providing smoking-quitting services.Only in this way can smoking be effectively controlled.

sczgjBzW.title: Study on Knowledge and Behavior About Medication Use Among Residents in Luwan District
sczgjBzW.abstract: OBJECTIVE To understand the residents' knowledge and behavior about medication use in Luwan District,Shanghai City,and to provide evidence for intervention.METHOD A cross-sectional study was applied with convenience-based sampling in 72 community of Luwan District,there were 8 residents sampled at each community.A self-designed questionnaire was used to investigate.The residents were visited by face to face interview,the date about demographic,knowledge about medication use,behavior about medication use were collected.RESULT There are five questions about medication use,including how many doses of children,making an injection when illness,medical dosage reduce after health care products usage reasonable use of antibiotics,the meaning of OTC,with the rates of 42.2%,64.1%,75.2%,68.2%,38.1% by residents,women better than men,higher educations'better than others'.Doctor's advice or recommendation survey is still the main way to choice drugs,and pharmacies or hospitals are the main places to buy drugs of residents,older respondents more likely to accept the doctor's advice and purchase of drugs in hospitals.There are 89.6% residents with some drugs at home,59.6% residents would be taking medication by doctor's advice.44.7% residents will be thrown away expired drugs.CONCLUSION Residents are lack of knowledge about medication use,and have some bad behavior about medication use.There should be increased publicity,reduce the incidence of adverse drug reactions.

z7PgjguL.title: Analysis on Health Status of Low-income Residents in Luwan District,Shanghai
z7PgjguL.abstract: Objective To study low-income residents' health status and provide better health services,in order to improve their health.Methods Health survey questionnaire is developed to collect data,and use it to collect much information,such as body mass index(BMI),waist circumference,two weeks prevalence rate,and so on.Through self-evaluation,to assess the frequency of various health symptoms in the past six months.Results 27.4% low-income residents is overweight and 7.6% of them is obesity.17.1% low-income residents' waist circumference is not normal,the chronic disease prevalence rate and two weeks prevalence of them are 43.9% and 16.6%.Only 14.5% low-income residents considered their health status was good or very good.The influence factor of health status is physiological,psychological,social role and income,female is better than male in psychological and social role.Conclusion Community health service is the best way to protect health status of low-income residents in city.

d30lLKVL.title: Study on Knowledge of Respiratory Communicable Diseases among Residents in Luwan District,Shanghai
d30lLKVL.abstract: Objective To understand the residents' knowledge about respiratory communicable diseases in Luwan District,Shanghai,and to provide evidence for health education.Methods A cross-sectional study was applied.By stratified random sampling,4 communities were selected among 72 communities.Thirty residents were investigated with a self-designed questionnaire at each community.The residents were intercepted and visited by face to face interview by doctors of community health center in neighborhood committee.Results The average score is 7.82 of the knowledge about respiratory communicable diseases among residents,and the passing rate is 93.1%.Conclusion The research subjects have a good knowledge of respiratory communicable diseases prevention and the necessary skills of first aid.But they are lack of knowledge about measles,chickenpox,ECM and influenza A(H1N1),which should be enhanced in the future.

5RfGUSSq.title: Investigation and Analysis on the Environmental Quality of the Tobacco-controlling Public Places in Luwan District in Shanghai
5RfGUSSq.abstract: Objective To find out the situation of tobacco control in public places in Luwan District,Shanghai and offer references on the further implementation of Rules on Controlling Smoking in the Public Places of Shanghai.Methods The people from 142 departments in Luwan district such as medical institutions,schools,state institutions,and restaurants were selected to answer the standard questionnaires.Investigators entered the public places mentioned above and watched the environments around for about 30 minutes as customers at busy time.The results were recorded in a unified form of Situations of Tobacco Control Environment Survey.Results The rate of public places without Non-tobacco publicity data was 18.3% with 6.3% of public places having no posters of signs on ban-smoking.Cigarette butts and smokers were found in 15 and 17 public places respectively.Conclusion The situation of tobacco control in restaurants,amusement arcade,and offices is worse than that in medical institutions,schools.Therefore much work should be done in the future.

2UxCoiT0.title: Survey on Smoking Status Quo of Adolescent in Luwan District, Shanghai
2UxCoiT0.abstract: Objective To probe an effective countermeasure of reducing smoking rate and intervening smoking behavior among adolescent. Methods After multi-stage sampling, the survey was carried out in a junior high school, a senior high school and a vocational school by questionnaires. Results It indicated that the average smoking age of adolescent was 14.79±1.41 age. The knowledge rates of smoking and second-hand smoking harm were high, about 85.6% and 77.9%. 47.9% of persons did not know Framework Convention on Tobacco Control. The smoking status quo of students in junior high school was different from that of students in senior high school and vocational school. The smoking status quo of students in senior school was not different from that of students in vocational school. Conclusion Comprehensive methods should be adopted to adolescent by the intervention with schools, families and society.

bAVWLawx.title: Cost analysis of four chronic diseases in 3 tier medical institutes
bAVWLawx.abstract: Medical resource effective allocation was key issue in medical management system. Cost structure of hypertension,coronary heart disease,cerebral infarction and diabetes in tertiary hospital,secondary hospital and primary hospital was analyzed. Based on the medical guideline,cost was divided into in guideline cost and out guideline cost. Tertiary hospital obeyed the guideline well but community health institute was not. In chronic diseases prevention and treatment,government regulation,treatment standardization,evidence based treatment and using safety,effective,economic drug,innovation medical insurance system were considered to solve high cost and in-equity health resource allocation.

gDAgCz5l.title: Analysis and Optimization of Juridical Person Management Structure in China's Public Hospital Group
gDAgCz5l.abstract: Along with the development of public hospital group,the construction and perfection of juridical person management structure,by taking group as unit,act as an important factor to affect deep development of the hospital groups. Basing on the elaboration of relevant ideas of juridical person management structure and basic framew ork,the authors analyze the issues that require attention on the construction of juridical person management structure in public hospital group from multiple view s of point and put forw ard the relevant suggestions on further optimization of juridical person management structure.

G1nj4nvt.title: Primary Exploration in Establishment of China’s Intelligent Medical Treatment
G1nj4nvt.abstract: Intelligent medical treatment born of intelligent earth has been widely concerned in recent years as the new stage of medical health informatization construction.The authors make a systematic research and discussion of the idea of intelligent medical treatment,the main contents and development trend,point out the problems of attention in the construction of intelligent medical treatment and put forward suggestions for the overall promotion of the construction of intelligent medical treatment.

X3SHs5RD.title: Sol-gel deposition and luminescence properties of spherical phosphors Ca2y8(SiO4)6O2:Eu 3+
X3SHs5RD.abstract: Spherical SiO2 particles were coated with Ca2Y 8(SiO4)6O2:Eu3+ phosphor layers through a sol-gel process. The results of XRD (X-ray diffraction) analysis indicated that the phosphors crystallized completely at 1000°C AFM study revealed that the average grain size is 500 nm. In Ca2Y 8(SiO4)6O2:Eu3+ spherical phosphors, the Eu3+ showed its characteristic red emission at 612 nm(5D0-7F2) upon excitation into its charge transfer band of Eu3+-O2- at 242nm.

dVQfFYHP.title: Silica supported submicron SiO2@Y2SiO 5:Eu3+ and SiO2@Y2SiO 5:Ce3+/Tb3+ spherical particles with a core-shell structure: Sol-gel synthesis and characterization
dVQfFYHP.abstract: X1-Y2SiO5:Eu3+ and X 1-Y2SiO5:Ce3+ and/or Tb3+ phosphor layers have been coated on nonaggregated, monodisperse, submicron spherical SiO2 particles by a sol-gel process, followed by surface reaction at high temperature (1000°C), to give core/shell structured SiO2@Y2SiO5:Eu3+ and SiO 2@Y2SiO5:Ce3+/Tb3+ particles. X-ray diffraction (XRD), field emission scanning electron microscopy (FESEM), TEM, photoluminescence (PL), low voltage cathodoluminescence (CL), and time-resolved PL spectra and lifetimes are used to characterize these materials. The XRD results indicate that X1-Y2SiO5 layers have been successfully coated on the surface of SiO2 particles, as further verified by the FESEM and TEM images. The PL and CL studies suggest that SiO2@Y2SiO5:Eu3+, SiO 2@Y2SiO5:Tb3+ (or Ce 3+/Tb3+), and SiO2@Y2SiO 5:Ce3+ core/shell particles exhibit red (Eu3+, 613 nm: 5D0-7F2), green (Tb 3+, 542 nm: 5D4-7F5), or blue (Ce3+, 450 nm: 5d-4f) luminescence, respectively. PL excitation, emission, and time-resolved spectra demonstrate that there is an energy transfer from Ce3+ to Tb3+ in the SiO2@Y 2SiO5:Ce3+,Tb3+ core/shell particles. © Wiley-VCH Verlag GmbH & Co. KGaA, 2006.

19alzmJ7.title: Syntheses of Ag, PbSe, and PbTe nanocrystals and their binary self-assembly exploration at low size-ratio.
19alzmJ7.abstract: Nanocrystals of Ag, PbSe, and PbTe were prepared via a high-temperature organic solution approach, respectively. Using a size-selection technique, the size-distribution of each set of nanocrystals could be fine-tuned and finally monodisperse products were achieved. Superlattice structure of binary self-assemblies in low size-ratio were also explored and characterized by transmission electron microscopy. It is realized that a success of achieving binary self-assembly pattern is greatly dependent on several key factors including particle size-distributions, relative concentrations of both components, as well as the size-ratios between Ag and PbSe (or PbTe) nanocrystals.

lTHwFDps.title: Enhanced near-infrared quantum cutting luminescence in 1,2,4,5- benzenetetracarboxylic acid/NaYF4:Tb3+, Yb3+ hybrid nanoparticles
lTHwFDps.abstract: The ultra-small-sized NaYF4:Tb3+, Yb3+ nanoparticles and hybrid L-NaYF4:Tb3+, Yb3+ (L: dehydro-1,2,4,5-benzenetetracarboxylic acid) nanoparticles have been prepared by a hydrothermal synthesis and water bath reflux method. X-Ray diffraction (XRD), transmission electron microscopy (TEM), high-resolution TEM (HRTEM), Fourier transform infrared (FTIR) spectra, UV-vis absorption spectra, diffuse reflectance spectra, photoluminescence (PL) spectra, as well as kinetic decay are used to characterize the resulting samples. The hybrid nanoparticles display a broad absorption band from 230 nm to 530 nm by monitoring 2F 5/2 → 2F7/2 transition of Yb3+ at 977 nm. Upon the excitation of π-π* transition of the organic 1,2,4,5-benzenetetracarboxylic acid (label with H4L), the strong NIR emission at about 1000 nm that matches to energy of Si band gap of Si-based solar cells is obtained. As a downconversion luminescent converter, this kind of material might be useful in Si-based solar cells to reduce thermalization loss and enhance conversion efficiency of solar cells via spectral modification. © 2013 The Royal Society of Chemistry.

3uYEmdPU.title: Spherical SiO 2@GdPO 4: Eu 3+ core-shell phosphors: Sol-gel synthesis and characterization
3uYEmdPU.abstract: Nanocrystalline GdPO 4 : Eu 3+ phosphor layers were coated on non-aggregated, monodisperse and spherical SiO 2 particles by Pechini sol-gel method, resulting in the formation of core-shell structured SiO 2@GdPO 4 : Eu 3+ particles. X-ray diffraction (XRD), Fourier transform infrared spectroscopy (FT-IR), field emission scanning electron microscopy (FESEM), transmission electron microscopy (TEM), photoluminescence (PL), low-voltage cathodoluminescence (CL), time-resolved PL spectra and lifetimes were used to characterize the core-shell structured materials. Both XRD and FT-IR results indicate that GdPO 4 layers have been successfully coated on the SiO 2 particles, which can be further verified by the images of FESEM and TEM. Under UV light excitation, the SiO 2@GdPO 4 : Eu 3+ phosphors show orange-red luminescence with Eu 3+ 5D 0- 7F 1 (593 nm) as the most prominent group. The PL excitation and emission spectra suggest that an energy transfer occurs from Gd 3+ to Eu 3+ in SiO 2@GdPO 4:Eu 3+ phosphors. The obtained core-shell phosphors have potential applications in FED and PDP devices. Copyright © 2007 American Scientific Publishers All rights reserved.

o1cRG7dt.title: Enhanced emission of ultra-small-sized LaF 3:RE 3+ (RE = Eu, Tb) nanoparticles through 1,2,4,5-benzenetetracarboxylic acid sensitization
o1cRG7dt.abstract: Uniform, ultra-small-sized and well-water-dispersible LaF 3 nanoparticles doped with trivalent rare earth (RE) ions (Eu 3+ or Tb 3+) have been synthesized by a simple, low temperature synthesis route. The nanoparticles, with sizes of about 3.2 nm (for those doped with Eu 3+) and 3.0 nm (for those doped with Tb 3+), are roughly spherical and monodisperse. 1,2,4,5-Benzenetetracarboxylic acid (labeled as BA) as sensitizer has been bonded to the surface of the nanoparticles, which can sensitize the emission of RE 3+ in the LaF 3 nanoparticles. The BA-LaF 3:RE 3+ (RE = Eu or Tb) nanoparticles have a broad absorption band in the UV domain, and show enhanced luminescence of RE 3+ based on an energy transfer from BA ligands to RE 3+ ions (i.e. the so-called "antenna effect"). Due to the dual protection of organic ligands (BA) and inorganic matrices (LaF 3), BA-LaF 3:RE 3+ (RE = Eu or Tb) nanoparticles have longer excited state lifetimes than LaF 3:RE 3+ (RE = Eu or Tb) nanoparticles as well as lanthanide coordination polymers of BA. This journal is © The Royal Society of Chemistry 2012.

C5j3auUw.title: Synthesis and luminescence properties of monodisperse spherical y 2O3:Eu3+@SiO2 particles with core-shell structure
C5j3auUw.abstract: Y2O3:Eu3+ phosphor layers were deposited on monodisperse SiO2 particles with different sizes (300, 500, 900, and 1200 nm) via a sol-gel process, resulting in the formation of Y 2O3:Eu3+@SiO2 core-shell particles. X-ray diffraction (XRD), Fourier transform infrared spectroscopy (FT-IR), field emission scanning electron microscopy (FE-SEM), transmission electron microscopy (TEM), time-resolved photoluminescence (PL) spectra, and lifetimes were employed to characterize the Y2O3:Eu3+@SiO 2 core-shell samples. The results of XRD indicated that the Y 2O3:Eu3+ layers began to crystallize on the silica surfaces at 600 °C and the crystallinity increased with the elevation of annealing temperature until 900 °C. The obtained core-shell particles have perfect spherical shape with narrow size distribution and non-agglomeration. The thickness of the shells could be easily controlled by changing the number of deposition cycles (60 nm for three deposition cycles). Under the excitation of ultraviolet (250 nm), the Eu3+ ion mainly shows its characteristic red (611 nm, 5D0- 7F2) emissions in the core-shell particles from Y 2O3:Eu3+ shells. The emission intensity Eu 3+ can be tuned by the annealing temperature, SiO2 core size, the number of coating cycles, and polyethylene glycol (PEG) concentration in the precursor solution, respectively. © 2007 American Chemical Society.

sUDwfubP.title: Spindle-like Lanthanide Orthovanadate Nanoparticles: Facile Synthesis by Ultrasonic Irradiation, Characterization, and Luminescent Properties

ai4Ta6Xe.title: Facile sonochemical synthesis and photoluminescent properties of lanthanide orthophosphate nanoparticles
ai4Ta6Xe.abstract: Uniform lanthanide orthophosphate LnPO4 (Ln=La, Ce, Pr, Nd, Sm, Eu, Gd, Tb, Dy, Ho) nanoparticles have been systematically synthesized via a facile, fast, efficient ultrasonic irradiation of inorganic salt aqueous solution under ambient conditions without any surfactant or template. X-ray diffraction (XRD), scanning electron microscopy (SEM), transmission electron microscopy (TEM), high-resolution transmission electron microscopy (HRTEM), selected area electron diffraction (SAED), photoluminescence (PL) spectra as well as kinetic decays were employed to characterize the samples. The SEM and the TEM images show that the hexagonal structured lanthanide orthophosphate LnPO4 (Ln=La, Ce, Pr, Nd, Sm, Eu, Gd) products have nanorod bundles morphology, while the tetragonal LnPO4 (Ln=Tb, Dy, Ho) samples prepared under the same experimental conditions are composed of nanoparticles. HRTEM micrographs and SAED results prove that these nanostructures are polycrystalline in nature. The possible formation mechanism for LnPO4 (Ln=La-Gd) nanorod bundles is proposed. Eu3+-doped LaPO4 and Tb3+-doped CePO4 samples were also prepared by using the same synthetic process, which exhibit an orange-red (Eu3+:5D0-7F1, 2, 3, 4) and green (Tb3+, 5D4-7F3, 4, 5, 6) emission, respectively. © 2008 Elsevier Inc. All rights reserved.

5acIbPVC.title: Nanostructured CaWO 4, CaWO 4: Pb 2+ and CaWO 4: Tb 3+ particles: Polyol-mediated synthesis and luminescent properties
5acIbPVC.abstract: Nano-submicrostructured CaWO 4, CaWO 4: Pb 2+ and CaWO 4: Tb 3+ particles were prepared by polyol method and characterized by X-ray diffraction (XRD), field emission scanning electron microscopy (FE-SEM), transmission electron microscopy (TEM), Fourier transform infrared spectra (FT-IR), thermogravimetry-differential thermal analysis (TG-DTA), photoluminescence (PL), cathodoluminescence (CL) spectra and PL lifetimes. The results of XRD indicate that the as-prepared samples are well crystallized with the scheelite structure of CaWO 4. The FE-SEM images illustrate that CaWO 4 and CaWO 4 : Pb 2+ and CaWO 4 : Tb 3+ powders are composed of spherical particles with sizes around 260, 290, and 190 nm respectively, which are the aggregates of smaller nanoparticles around 10-20 nm. Under the UV light or electron beam excitation, the CaWO 4 powders exhibits a blue emission band with a maximum at about 440 nm. When the CaWO 4 particles are doped with Pb 2+, the intensity of luminescence is enhanced to some extent and the luminescence band maximum is red shifted to 460 nm. Tb 3+-doped CaWO 4 particles show the characteristic emission of Tb 3+ 5D 4- 7F J (J = 6-3) transitions due to an energy transfer from WO 4 2- groups to Tb 3+. Copyright © 2007 American Scientific Publishers All rights reserved.

M5hljAhc.title: Synthesis of PbSeTe single ternary alloy and core/shell heterostructured nanocubes.
M5hljAhc.abstract: We report a robust method for synthesis of monodisperse PbSeTe single ternary alloy and core/shell heterostructured nanocubes, respectively. The key synthetic strategy to produce such different classes of nanocubes is to precisely control the time of reaction and successive growth. The crystallinity, shape/size distributions, structural characteristics, and compositions of as-prepared nanocubes, both ternary alloy and core/shell, were carefully studied. A plausible growth mechanism for developing each type of lead chalcogenide nanocubes is proposed. These delicately designed PbSeTe nanoscale architectures offer tunable compositions in PbSeTe ternary alloy and nano-interfaces in core/shell nanocubes, which are the critical factors in controlling thermal conductivity for applications in thermoelectrics.

WDRE4DDg.title: Host-sensitized luminescence of Dy3+ in nanocrystalline β-Ga2O3 prepared by a pechini-type sol-gel process
WDRE4DDg.abstract: Nanocrystalline undoped β-Ga2O3 and Dy 3+-doped β-Ga2O3 were prepared through a Pechini-type sol-gel process. All the samples began to crystallize at 600°C, and the crystallinity increased with the increase of annealing temperatures until 1000°C. Field emission-scanning electron microscopy study revealed that the β-Ga2O3 :Dy3+ sample is composed of aggregated particles with sizes ranging from 40 to 80 nm and spherical morphology. Undoped β-Ga2O3 sample shows a strong blue emission peaking at 438 nm. The Dy3+ mainly occupied the octahedral Ga3+ sites in β-Ga2O3, shows its characteristic emissions in the blue 460-505 nm (4F 9/2-6H13/2) and yellow 570-0600 nm ( 4F9/2-6H13/2) regions due to an efficient energy transfer from the β-Ga2O3; host lattices. The optimum concentration for the luminescence Dy3,+ is determined to be. 2 atom % of Ga3+ in Ga2O 3host. © 2004 The Electrochemical Society. A11 rights reserved.

Cc76ycIK.title: Study of quasi-monodisperse In2O3 nanocrystals: synthesis and optical determination.
Cc76ycIK.abstract: In this communication, we report a successful synthesis of quasi-monodisperse In2O3 nanocrystals with high crystallinity in a high-temperature organic solution. The average size of nanocrystals can be tuned using a dynamic injection technique. TEM and XRD investigations indicate that each nanocrystal is a single crystal. The optical determination implies that the photoluminescence behavior of these In2O3 nanocrystals is different from that of the bulk, probably due to the combination of weak quantum-confinement-effects and the nature of high crystallinity in nanocrystals.

z0cX5q05.title: Shape evolution and self assembly of monodisperse PbTe nanocrystals.
z0cX5q05.abstract: In this communication, we report our recent achievement in synthesis and self-assembly of both spherical and cubic PbTe nanocrystals using a high-temperature solution-phase synthesis approach. The possible mechanism of nanocrystalline evolution from spherical to cubic structure has also been discussed. It is possible to use the highly orientated PbTe nanocrystals as building blocks to achieve thickness-controlled film for further manipulation into thermoelectric devices.
z0cX5q05.venue: Journal of the American Chemical Society

GNXPOYDE.title: Y2O3: Eu3+ microspheres: Solvothermal synthesis and luminescence properties
GNXPOYDE.abstract: Y2O3 : Eu3+ microspheres, with an average diameter of 3 μm, were successfully prepared through a large-scale and facile solvothermal method followed by a subsequent heat treatment. X-ray diffraction, Fourier transform infrared spectroscopy, energy-dispersive X-ray spectra, thermogravimetric and differential thermal analysis, inductive coupled plasma atomic absorption spectrometric analysis, scanning electron microscopy, transmission electron microscopy, photoluminescence spectra, as well kinetic decays, and cathodoluminescence spectra were used to characterize the samples. These microspheres were actually composed of randomly aggregated nanoparticles. The formation mechanisms for the Y2O3 : Eu3+ microspheres have been proposed on an isotropic growth mechanism. The Y 2O3 : Eu3+ microspheres show a strong red emission corresponding to 5D0 → 7F 2 transition (610 nm) of Eu3+ under ultraviolet excitation (259 nm) and low-voltage electron beams excitation (1-5 kV), which have potential applications in fluorescent lamps and field emission displays. © 2007 American Chemical Society.

AB3CWI1M.title: Sol-gel synthesis and characterization of Si O2 @NaGd (W O4) 2: Eu3+ core-shell-structured spherical phosphor particles
AB3CWI1M.abstract: Monodisperse, core-shell-structured Si O2 @NaGd (W O4) 2: Eu3+ particles were prepared by the sol-gel method. The samples were characterized by X-ray diffraction, field emission scanning electron microscopy, transmission electron microscopy, photoluminescence (PL), and low-voltage cathodoluminescence (CL) as well as time-resolved PL spectra and lifetimes. PL and CL study revealed that the core-shell-structured Si O2 @NaGd (W O4) 2: Eu3+ particles show strong red emission dominated by the D05 - F27 transition of Eu3+ at 614 nm with a lifetime of 0.74 ms. The PL and CL emission intensity can be tuned by the coating number of NaGd (W O4) 2: Eu3+ phosphor layers on Si O2 and by accelerating voltage and the filament current, respectively. © 2006 The Electrochemical Society.

pHa0dlyG.title: Fabrication and optical properties of core–shell structured spherical SiO2@GdVO4:Eu3+ phosphors via sol–gel process
pHa0dlyG.abstract: Europium-doped nanocrystalline GdVO4 phosphor layers were coated on the surface of preformed submicron silica spheres by sol-gel method. The resulted SiO2@Gd0.95Eu0.05VO4 core-shell particles were characterized by X-ray diffraction (XRD), Fourier transform infrared spectroscopy (FT-IR), scanning electron microscopy (FESEM), energy-dispersive X-ray spectra (EDS), transmission electron microscopy (TEM), photoluminescence (PL) spectra, low voltage cathodoluminescence (CL), time resolved PL spectra and kinetic decays. The XRD results demonstrate that the Gd0.95Eu0.05VO4 layers begin to crystallize on the SiO2 spheres after annealing at 600 °C and the crystallinity increases with raising the annealing temperature. The obtained core-shell phosphors have spherical shape, narrow size distribution (average size ca. 600 nm), non-agglomeration. The thickness of the Gd0.95Eu0.05VO4 shells on the SiO2 cores could be easily tailored by varying the number of deposition cycles (50 nm for four deposition cycles). PL and CL show that the emissions are dominated by 5D0-7F2 transition of Eu3+ (618 nm, red). The PL and CL intensities of Eu3+ increase with increasing the annealing temperature and the number of coating cycles. The optimum concentration for Eu3+ was determined to be 5 mol% of Gd3+ in GdVO4 host. © 2006 Elsevier Inc. All rights reserved.

O4QHwRcZ.title: Facile synthesis and characterization of single crystalline Bi 2S3 with various morphologies
O4QHwRcZ.abstract: Single crystalline Bi2S3 with various morphologies (wires, rods, and flowers) has been successfully prepared via a simple polyol solution process and characterized by X-ray diffraction (XRD), field emission scanning electron microscopy (FESEM), and transmission electron microscopy (TEM) techniques. The morphologies of Bi2S3 crystals are highly dependent on the experimental parameters, including the reaction temperature, reactant ratio, sulfur source, and additive. The adjustment of these parameters can lead to an obvious shape evolution of products, and the growth mechanism has been proposed. The results reveal that excess S source is favorable for the formation of high-quality Bi2S3 nanostructures; the dimensions of Bi2S3 are highly dependent on the nature of S source materials; the employment of additives in the reaction process results in the appearance of flower-like Bi2S3 microstructures. This reaction system could be extended for the preparation of other metal chalcogenides nano- and micromaterials. © 2008 American Chemical Society.

rWNYf5C7.title: Polyol-mediated synthesis and photoluminescent properties of Ce 3+ and/or Tb 3+-doped LaPO 4 nanoparticles
rWNYf5C7.abstract: Rare-earth ion (Ce 3+, Tb 3+) doped LaPO 4 nanoparticles were prepared by the polyol method and characterized by X-ray diffraction (XRD), field emission scanning electron microscopy (FE-SEM), UV-vis absorption spectroscopy, photoluminescence (PL) spectroscopy, and lifetimes. The results of XRD indicate that the as-prepared nanoparticles are well-crystallized at 160°C and assigned to the monoclinic monazite structure of the LaPO 4 phase. The obtained LaPO 4:Ce 3+, Tb 3+ nanoparticles are spherical with narrow size distribution and average size of 20 nm. The doped rare-earth ions show their characteristic emission in LaPO 4 nanoparticles, i.e., Ce 3+ 5d-4f and Tb 3+ 5D 4- 7F J (J = 6-3) transitions, respectively. The optimum doping concentration for Tb 3+ in La 0.8-xCe 0.2Tb xPO 4 nanoparticles is determined to be 15 mol% (x = 0.15). The luminescence decay curves of Ce 3+ in LaPO 4:Ce 3+ and LaPO 4:Ce 3+, Tb 3+ nanoparticles present a single-exponential behavior, and the lifetimes (τ) of Ce 3+ decrease with increasing Tb 3+ concentrations (at the constant Ce 3+ concentration) in LaPO 4:Ce 3+, Tb 3+ nanoparticles due to the energy transfer from Ce 3+ to Tb 3+. The energy-transfer efficiency from Ce 3+ to Tb 3+ was calculated, which depends on the doping concentrations of Tb 3+ if the concentration of Ce 3+ is fixed. Copyright © 2005 American Scientific Publishers All rights reserved.

ebGqnOxi.title: Preparation and luminescence properties of Lu2O3:Eu3+ nanofibers by sol–gel/electrospinning process
ebGqnOxi.abstract: One-dimensional Lu 2 O 3 :Eu 3+ nanofibers have been prepared by a combination method of sol–gel process and electrospinning. The as-formed precursor samples present uniform fiberlike morphology. After annealing the precursors at 900 °C, the Lu 2 O 3 :Eu 3+ nanofibers are uniform with diameters ranging from 90 to 180 nm. Under ultraviolet excitation and the low-voltage electron beam excitation, Lu 2 O 3 :Eu 3+ nanofibers all exhibit typical red (612 nm) emission corresponding to 5 D 0 – 7 F 2 transition of Eu 3+ . Abstract One-dimensional Lu 2 O 3 :Eu 3+ nanofibers have been prepared by a combination method of sol–gel process and electrospinning technology. X-ray diffraction (XRD), Fourier transform infrared spectroscopy (FT-IR), thermogravimetric and differential thermal analysis (TG–DTA), scanning electron microscopy (SEM), energy-dispersive X-ray spectrum (EDS), transmission electron microscopy (TEM), high-resolution transmission electron microscopy (HRTEM), photoluminescence (PL), and cathodoluminescence (CL) spectra were used to characterize the samples. The XRD, FT-IR and TG–DTA results show that Lu 2 O 3 :Eu 3+ samples crystallize at 900 °C. SEM images indicate that as prepared precursor samples and those annealed at 900 °C present uniform fiberlike morphology. After being heated at 900 °C, the diameters of fibers decrease greatly, ranging from 90 to 180 nm. TEM image further manifests that the as-formed Lu 2 O 3 :Eu 3+ nanofibers consist of nanoparticles (the crystallite size is about 16.5 nm). Under the short wavelength ultraviolet irradiation and the low-voltage electron beam excitation, Lu 2 O 3 :Eu 3+ nanofibers all exhibit typical red ( 5 D 0 – 7 F J ) emission. The optimum doping concentration of Eu 3+ in the Lu 2 O 3 nanofibers also has been investigated. Keywords Electrospinning Lu 2 O 3 Europium Luminescence Nanofibers 1 Introduction Generally many important properties of nanomaterials depend not only on the particle size but also on their morphology and structure. One-dimensional (1D) structured metal oxides, such as nanowires (NWs), nanorods, nanotubes (NTs), and nanobelts, exhibit novel physical and chemical properties due to their unique and fascinating characteristics for huge ratio of diameter to length, superior mechanical toughness, and so on [1–6] . It can be used in optical, data-storage devices and nanoelectronic devices [7–9] . Many methods have been used to prepare one-dimensional (1D) nanomaterials, including chemical or physical vapor deposition [10–13] , laser ablation [10,14] , solution [15] , arc discharge [16,17] , vapor-phase transport process [18–20] , and a template-based method [21–23] . Compared to these, electrospinning is a more simple and cost-effective approach. Electrospinning technology has been used since 1930s to prepare one-dimensional (1D) nanomaterials [24] . It is a process that uses the strong electrostatic force by a high static voltage applied to a polymer solution placed into a container with a millimeter diameter nozzle. Under the applied electrical force, the polymer solution is ejected from the nozzle. After the solvents are evaporated during the course of jet spraying, the hybrid samples are collected on a grounded collector. Organic, inorganic and hybrid (organic–inorganic) compounds all can be electrospun to form uniform fibers [25–28] . Sol–gel techniques can be employed to prepare precursor solution, which has been proved as an efficient way to produce nanoparticles [29] . (1D) nanomaterials fabricated by a combination method of sol–gel process and electrospinning have become important for exceptional length, uniform diameter, diverse composition, and high surface. Rare earth oxides have been extensively used in high performance luminescent devices, magnets, catalysts, and other functional materials because of their electronic, optical, and chemical characteristics arising from the 4f electronic [30–34] , and most of these functions depend strongly on the composition and structure of materials. Recently, Lu 2 O 3 has been recognized one of the promising host lattices for application in X-ray imagery because of its high density (9.4 g/cm 3 ), high atomic number of Lu ( Z = 71), and high physical and chemical stability. Furthermore, because the Lu 2 O 3 has a much higher density (9.4 g/cm 3 ) than Y 2 O 3 (5.01 g/cm 3 ), Lu 2 O 3 :Eu 3+ may have more advantage in FED application because it can resist the bombardment of electron beam more effectively than Y 2 O 3 . Lu 2 O 3 activated with Eu 3+ is considered to be an interesting X-ray phosphor, which may serve as efficient X-ray detector in digital planar X-ray medical imaging, with an X-ray absorptivity unsurpassed among current scintillator materials, a light output comparable to CsI:TI, and an emission wavelength much better matched to the spectral sensitivity of typical CCD arrays [35,36] . To further reduce the images blurring by reducing the scattering of light within the phosphor layer, more attention has been paid to the Lu 2 O 3 :Eu 3+ nanomaterials. Therefore, it is very important to synthesize Lu 2 O 3 :Eu 3+ nanomaterials in both fundamental research and practical applications. To our knowledge, many methods have been mentioned in literature to prepare Lu 2 O 3 :Eu 3+ nanomaterials [37–40] , but the electrospinning preparation has not been reported. So in this paper, we prepared the Lu 2 O 3 :Eu 3+ nanofibers by a combination menthod of sol–gel process and electrospinning technology, and investigated the morphology, structure, photoluminescence and cathodoluminescence properties. 2 Materials and methods 2.1 Materials Lu 2 O 3 and Eu 2 O 3 (99.99%) were purchased from Science and Technology Parent Company of Changchun Institute of Applied Chemistry. Nitric acid HNO 3 (AR), citric acid monohydrate C 6 H 8 O 7 ⋅H 2 O (⩾9.5%, AR) and ethanol were all purchased from Beijing Fine Chemical Company. Polyvinylpyrrolidone (PVP, M w = 1,300,000) was purchased from Aldrich. All the initial chemicals were used without further purification. 2.2 Preparation of Lu 2 O 3 :Eu 3+ Lu 2(1− x ) O 3 :2 x Eu 3+ ( x = 0–8 mol%) nanofibers were prepared by a method of sol –gel process and electrospinning. First, the stoichiometric amounts of Lu 2 O 3 and Eu 2 O 3 were dissolved in dilute nitric acid under heating, and then were mixed with water–ethanol (v/v = 3:7) solution containing a suitable amount of citric acid (the molar ratio of metal ions to citric acid is 1:2) as a chelating agent for metal ions. Then an appropriate amount of PVP (the weight percentage of PVP is 8% in the water–ethanol solution) were added into above solution to obtain the viscous solution for electrospinning. Then the precursor solution was stirred for 4 h to form a transparent solution for electrospinning. A typical electrospinning setup was composed of a syringe, a high-voltage power supply, a flat tip needle, and a grounded collector. The transparent precursor solution was placed into a syringe with a flat tip needle. The anode from a high-voltage power was connected with the syringe needle flat tip. The cathode was linked to the grounded collector, and the distance between needle and collector was fixed at 16 cm. The high-voltage power supply was maintained at 10 kV, and the flow rate of spinning solution was controlled at 0.5 ml/h by a syringe pump (TJ-3A/W0109-1B, Boading Longer Precision Pump Co., Ltd., China). In this way, the precursor fibers were prepared. Finally, the precursor fibers were annealed at 600, 800 and 900 °C for 3 h with a heating rate of 2 °C/min respectively to remove the organic species and to form the final Lu 2 O 3 :Eu 3+ fibers. 2.3 Characterization The X-ray powder diffraction (XRD) measurements were carried out on a Rigaku-Dmax 2500 diffractometer using Cu K a radiation ( λ = 0.15405 nm). FT-IR spectra were measured with a Perkin-Elmer 580B infrared spectrophotometer with the KBr pellet technique. Thermogravimetric and differential thermal analysis (TG–DTA) data were recorded with a Thermal Analysis instrument (SDT 2960, TA Instruments, New Castle, DE) with the heating rate of 10 °C min −1 in an air flow of 100 mL min −1 . The morphology and structure of the samples were inspected using a field emission scanning electron microscope (FESEM, XL30, Philips) with an energy-dispersive X-ray spectroscope (EDS, JEOL JXA-840). Transmission electron microscopy (TEM) and high-resolution transmission electron microscopy (HRTEM) micrographs were obtained from a FEI Tecnai G 2 S-Twin transmission electron microscope with a field emission gun operating at 200 kV. The photoluminescence (PL) measurements were performed on a Hitachi F-4500 spectrophotometer equipped with a 150 W xenon lamp as the excitation source. The cathodoluminescent (CL) measurements were carried out in an ultrahigh-vacuum chamber (<10 −8 Torr), where the samples were excited by an electron beam at a voltage range of 3–5 kV with different filament currents, and the emission spectra were recorded using an F-4500 spectrophotometer. 3 Results and discussion 3.1 Formation process, structure and morphology XRD patterns of the as prepared precursor fibers for Lu 2 O 3 :6 mol% Eu 3+ and those were calcined at different temperatures (range from 600 °C to 900 °C) as well as the standard card of Lu 2 O 3 (JCPDS No. 65-3172) are shown respectively in Fig. 1 . In Fig. 1 b for the as prepared precursor samples, there is a broad band at 2 θ = 22°. In order to make clear what this broad band is assigned to, we measured the XRD patterns of pure PVP as shown in Fig. 1 a. From XRD patterns in Fig. 1 a and b, we can confirm that the broad band at 2 θ = 22° is ascribed to the semicrystalline PVP in precursor fibers. When precursor samples were annealed at 600 °C (in Fig. 2 c), well-defined diffraction peaks appeared, and all the diffraction peaks can be well-assigned to the standard card of Lu 2 O 3 . This manifests that the precursor samples have crystallized at this temperature. No other phase peaks are observed, indicating that the Eu 3+ ions have been effectively built into the Lu 2 O 3 host lattice. When the heating temperature reached 800 °C and 900 °C (in Fig. 2 d and e), all the diffraction peaks increase in intensity because of the increasing of crystallinity. The diffraction peaks of Lu 2 O 3 :6 mol% Eu 3+ nanofibers are shifted a little to lower angles with respect to the position of the standard card of Lu 2 O 3 (JCPDS No. 65-3172) pattern. This is because the Eu 3+ ion is bigger than the Lu 3+ ion in the Lu 2 O 3 host lattice [ R (Lu 3+ ) = 0.0848 nm and R (Eu 3+ ) = 0.0950 nm]. However, the shift is very small due to the low doping concentration of Eu 3+ . The lattice constant of the calcined product was calculated according to this equation (1) 1 / d 2 = ( h 2 + k 2 + l 2 ) / a 2 where d is the interplanar distance, h , k , l are the crystal indices (Miller indices), and a is the lattice constant. On the basis of the (2 2 2) crystal planes ( d = 0.300 nm in Fig. 5 b) the lattice constant is a = 1.0392 nm, which is well compatible with the literature value of a = 1.0391 nm (JCPDS: 65-3172). The FT-IR spectra of the as prepared precursor fibers for Lu 2 O 3 :6 mol% Eu 3+ and those heat-treated at 900 °C are shown in Fig. 2 . Some vibration bands of the OH group (3418 cm −1 ), CH 2 group (2956, 1468 and 1424 cm −1 ), C O group (1642 cm −1 ), carbonates COO − group (1384 cm −1 ), and tertiary amine group (1293 cm −1 ) are detected in Fig. 2 a, which come from precursor fibers (ethanol, citric acid, and PVP) [41–43] . After the precursor fibers were calcined at 900 °C for 3 h ( Fig. 2 b), the absorption peaks of vibration bands from precursor fibers disappear completely, and two new absorption bands are presented. The peaks centered at 548 cm −1 and 492 cm −1 are assigned to the Lu O bending vibrations of the cubic Lu 2 O 3 [44] , These indicate that crystalline-phase Lu 2 O 3 has formed after annealing at 900 °C, agreeing well with the results of XRD. TG–DTA curves of the as prepared precursor fibers are shown in Fig. 3 . TG curve display three stages of weight loss. The weight loss (20%) of first stage (40–190 °C) come from evaporation of water and alcohol. The second stage (190–350 °C) weight loss accompanied by two exothermic peak at 200 °C and 339 °C in the DTA curve is 55%, which can be attributed to the decomposition of organic groups (PVP, citric acid, and the citrates) [45,46] . Two exothermic peaks at 390 °C and 460 °C in the DTA curve are correspond with the third stage weight loss (10%) from 300 to 500 °C, which is caused by the further combustion of residual organic compounds. When the temperature reached above 500 °C, there was no change in weight loss, indicating the formation of pure inorganic oxide. The morphologies and structure of samples were investigated by the SEM and TEM observations. The SEM images of as prepared precursor fibers and those were heated at 900 °C are shown in Fig. 4 . Fig. 4 a and b are for low-magnification and high-magnification SEM images of the precursor fibers, respectively. From these images, it can be seen that the surface of the as prepared precursor fibers is smooth with diameters range from 250 to 480 nm. After being calcined at 900 °C for 3 h ( Fig. 4 c and d), the precursor fibers were converted to Lu 2 O 3 :Eu 3+ samples. The fiber diameters decrease greatly due to the decomposition of the organic species and the formation of inorganic phase (inorganic stuff also contract during the calcination process), the diameters become 90–180 nm. The EDS spectra ( Fig. 4 e) shows the presence of O, Lu and Eu (Au from the coating for SEM measurement), which further indicates the formation of Lu 2 O 3 (containing Eu) in the fibers. TEM and high resolution TEM (HRTEM) images of Lu 2 O 3 :6 mol% Eu 3+ nanofibers are shown in Fig. 5 a and b. From Fig. 5 a, it can be observed that the nanofibers are composed of fine and closely linked nanoparticles. Typical HRTEM image ( Fig. 5 b) of Lu 2 O 3 :6 mol% Eu 3+ nanofibers shows well-resolved lattice fringes. The distance between the adjacent lattice fringes is 0.300 nm, it corresponds to the interplanar spacing of Lu 2 O 3 (2 2 2) planes. The result further confirms the formation of crystalline Lu 2 O 3 in nanofibers after thermal treatment, agreeing well with the XRD results. In fact, in order to obtain fibers with uniform morphology, we must prepare a solution with a viscoelastic behavior similar to that of a conventional polymer solution, which is suitable for electrospinning. In our experiments, it is very important to control the volume ratio of water to alcohol and the weight percentage of PVP for the appropriate solution can be further electrospinning. At the same time, the morphology and diameter of the electrospun samples are also dependent on several process parameters, including the intrinsic properties of the solution and the operational conditions. Therefore, the key of this experiment is searching for a balance point of various electrospinning parameters. The balance point might be related to the volume ratio of water to alcohol, the weight percentage of PVP, the spinning rate, the strength of the electric field, and the distance between the spinneret and the collector. In our experiments, we searched the optimal ratio by changing the ratio of water and alcohol under same PVP content. From the SEM images ( Fig. 6 ) of Lu 2 O 3 :Eu 3+ fiberlike samples obtained by adjusting water/alcohol ratio (a – 3:7, b – 3:9, c – 3:11), it can be seen that the yield and morphology of samples vary. Additionally, when the water/alcohol ratio reaches or exceeds 3:5, no samples can be obtained by the electrospinning process. 3.2 Luminescence properties Fig. 7 exhibit (a) excitation and (b) emission spectrum of Lu 2 O 3 :6 mol% Eu 3+ nanofibers. The excitation spectra was obtained by monitoring the emission of the Eu 3+ transition at 612 nm, which ranging from 200 to 450 nm with two peaks at 216 and 237 nm. The intense peak at 216 nm can also be detected for pure Lu 2 O 3 in the diffuse reflection spectrum [47] . Obviously, it is due to the host absorption of Lu 2 O 3 [48] . The other band at 237 nm ascribes to Eu 3+ –O 2− charge transfer band (CTB) [48] . The appearance of this band implies that there is an energy transfer from host lattice to Eu 3+ ions as observed previously for Y 2 O 3 :Eu 3+ [49] . The emission spectrum was obtained under short-wavelength UV irradiation when excited by a 237 nm irradiation. All the spectra show typical emissions of Eu 3+ ions in cubic Lu 2 O 3 , which corresponds to 5 D 0 – 7 F J transitions ( J = 0–4). The most intense peak at 612 nm assigns to 5 D 0 – 7 F 2 transition. From the photoluminescence spectrum, it can be seen that nanofibers of Lu 2 O 3 :6 mol% Eu 3+ show strong red light emission under a 237 nm UV light irradiation. The dependence of the PL emission intensity on its doping concentration ( x ) in Lu 2(1− x ) O 3 :2 x mol% Eu 3+ nanofibers was shown in Fig. 8 . By varying the content of the Eu 3+ in the Lu 2 O 3 nanofibers, we determined the compositions with the highest PL emission intensity. From the Figure, it can been found that the PL emission intensity of Eu 3+ increase with the increase of its concentration ( x ) first, reaching a maximum value with the Eu 3+ concentration of 6 mol%, and then decrease with the increasing Eu 3+ concentration ( x ) due to the concentration quenching effect. Thus, the optimum concentration for Eu 3+ red emission is 6 mol% of Eu 3+ in Lu 2 O 3 nanofiber phosphors. The average distances ( R ) between Eu 3+ ions can be estimated in terms of the equation R = 2(3 V /4π XN ) 1/3 (where V is the volume of the unit cell, X is the concentration, and N is the number of available crystallographic sites occupied by the activator ions in the unit cell) [50] . The corresponding R (Eu 3+ –Eu 3+ ) values for Lu 2(1− x ) O 3 :2 x mol% Eu 3+ nanofibers are calculated (the related crystal parameters V = 1.124 nm 3 , Z = 16, and N = Z × 2 = 32). The average distances ( R ) between Eu 3+ ions is 1.038 nm when the doping concentration reaches 6 mol%. The CL spectra properties of Lu 2 O 3 :6 mol% Eu 3+ nanofibers were further investigated. The representative CL spectra of Lu 2 O 3 :6 mol% Eu 3+ nanofibers is shown in Fig. 9 a, which has identical shape as the PL emission spectra. Thus, under the low-voltage electron beam excitation, the Lu 2 O 3 :6 mol% Eu 3+ nanofibers also show red light emission. The CL emission intensity for Lu 2 O 3 :6 mol% Eu 3+ nanofibers has been investigated as a function of the filament current and accelerating voltage, as show in Fig. 9 b and c. When the filament current is fixed at 105 mA, the CL intensity increases with increasing the accelerating voltage from 3.0 to 5.0 kV. Similarly, when the accelerating voltage is maintained at 5 kV, the CL intensity increases with raising the filament current from 97 to 105 mA. The increase in CL brightness with an increase in electron energy and filament current are attributed to the deeper penetration of the electrons into the phosphors and the larger electron beam current density. The electron penetration depth can be estimated using the empirical formula L [Å] = 250( A / ρ )( E / Z 1/2 ) n , where n = 1.2/(1–0.29 log Z ), A is the atomic or molecular weight of the material, ρ is the bulk density, Z is the atomic number or the number of electrons per molecule in the case compounds, and E is the accelerating voltage (kV) [51] . For cathodoluminescence, the Eu 3+ ions are excited by the plasmons produced by the incident electrons. The deeper the electron penetration depth, the more plasma will be produced, which results in more Eu 3+ ions being excited and thus the CL intensity increases. 4 Summary In summary, one-dimensional Lu 2 O 3 :Eu 3+ nanofibers were successfully prepared by electrospinning technique in conjunction with sol–gel process. As prepared precursor samples present uniform fiberlike morphology and smooth surface with diameters ranging from 250 to 480 nm. After precursor annealed at 900 °C for 3 h, the as-formed samples are well-crystallized and still maintain their fiberlike morphology, except for the decreasing diameters. These as-formed Lu 2 O 3 :Eu 3+ nanofibers consist of linked nanoparticles with the diameters ranging from 90 to 180 nm. Under the short wavelength ultraviolet irradiation and the low-voltage electron beam excitation, Lu 2 O 3 :Eu 3+ nanofibers all exhibit typical red (Eu 3+ , 5 D 0 – 7 F J ) emission. The CL intensity increases with increasing accelerating voltage and filament current. The optimum doping concentration of Eu 3+ in the Lu 2 O 3 nanofibers is 6 mol%. Electrospinning technique is facile and low cost method for prepare 1D luminescent nanomaterials, it can be used to develop more other 1D luminescent nanomaterials. Acknowledgments This project is financially supported by the foundation of “Bairen Jihua” of Chinese Academy of Sciences, National Basic Research Program of China (2003CB314707, 2007CB935502), and the National Natural Science Foundation of China (NSFC 20921002, 60977013, 50872131).
